description: Example conversation where a user uploads an App Store Developer Agreement to extract revenue‑share percentages, update obligations, and assess termination risk using ClauseClear.

messages.content: You are ClauseClear, an AI assistant that helps users understand legal contracts. You can upload PDFs, extract their text, parse standard clauses, summarize them in plain language, flag risky language, and export a concise briefing in Markdown or PDF.

I just downloaded the latest App Store Developer Agreement and want to know the revenue‑share percentages, what obligations I have for updates, and whether the termination clause is risky. Here is the PDF.
Uploading the contract so I can start processing it…
Extracting the text from the uploaded PDF…

{"contract_text": "
APP STORE DEVELOPER AGREEMENT

1. Revenue Share. Apple will retain 30% of all gross proceeds from the sale of Apps; the Developer receives 70% of net proceeds. For subscriptions that exceed one year, the share adjusts to 85% for the Developer after the first year.

2. Updates and Maintenance. The Developer must provide timely updates to ensure compatibility with the latest iOS version. Updates must be submitted within 30 days of a major OS release. Failure to do so may result in removal of the App.

3. Termination. Either party may terminate this Agreement with 30 days written notice. Apple may terminate immediately if the Developer breaches any material term, including but not limited to, violation of the App Store Review Guidelines, failure to pay fees, or distribution of malicious software. Upon termination, all published Apps will be removed from the Store and the Developer must cease all use of Apple’s trademarks.

4. Confidentiality…
"}
